chapter.title: Knot DNS Configuration Reference
chapter.para: This reference describe every configuration option in Knot DNS.

section.title: system
section.para: The system statement contains general options related to the operating system and other general options which don't fit anywhere else.

para.programlisting: system { [ identity "string"; ] [ version "string"; ] [ nsid ( "string" | hex_string ); ] [ storage "string"; ] [ pidfile "string"; ] [ workers integer; ] [ user string[.string]; ] }

section.title: identity
section.para: Identity of the server (see RFC 4892). Not used yet.

section.title: version
section.para: Version of the server (see RFC 4892). Not used yet.

section.title: nsid
section.para: DNS Name Server Identifier (RFC 5001)
Use a string format "text" or a hexstring f.e. 0x01ab00

section.title: storage
section.para: The working directory of the Knot DNS, it is used to store compiled zone files and it's also a default location of the pidfile.

section.title: pidfile
section.para: Custom pidfile location.
Default value: knot.pid in storage directory)

section.title: workers
section.para: Number of workers (threads) per interface. This option is used to force number of threads used per interface.
Default value: unset (auto-estimates optimal value from the number of online CPUs)

section.title: user
section.para: System user or user.group under which the Knot DNS is run after starting and binding to interfaces.
Default value: root.root

section.title: keys
section.para: The keys statement sets up the TSIG keys used to authenticate zone transfers.

section.title: key_id
section.para: The key_id statement defines a secret shared key for use with TSIG. It consists of its name, algorithm and key contents.

Supported algoritms:
hmac-md5 hmac-sha1 hmac-sha224 hmac-sha256 hmac-sha384 hmac-sha512

You will need to use bind or ldns utils to generate TSIG keys. Knot DNS doesn't have it's own generation utilities yet.
$ dnssec-keygen -a HMAC-SHA256 -b 256 -n HOST foobar.example.com Kfoobar.example.com.+163+21239 $ cat Kfoobar.example.com.+163+21239.key foobar.example.com. IN KEY 512 3 163 rqv2WRyDgIUaHcJi03Zssor9jtG1kOpb3dPywxZfTeo=

section.title: interfaces
section.para: The interfaces statement contains IP interfaces where Knot DNS listens for incoming queries.

section.title: interface_id
section.para: The interface_id is a textual identifier of an IP interface, which consists of IP address and port.
The definition of interface can be written in long or a short form and it has always contain and IP (IPv4 or IPv6) address.
